clusters.title: US forces board oil tanker in Indian Ocean that fled Caribbean blockade
clusters.neutral_headline: US Boards Oil Tanker In Indian Ocean

items.title: US forces board oil tanker in Indian Ocean that fled Caribbean blockade
items.standfirst: The United States intercepted a new oil tanker in the Indian Ocean that had fled the blockade ordered by US President Donald Trump against sanctioned ships leaving or heading to Venezuela, the Pentagon announced on Sunday.
items.content: The United States intercepted a new oil tanker in the Indian Ocean that had fled the blockade ordered by US President Donald Trump against sanctioned ships leaving or heading to Venezuela, the Pentagon announced on Sunday.

items.title: Why did U.S. board oil tankers in the Indian Ocean? #world
items.standfirst: What investigators and officials say U.S. military forces intercepted and boarded at least one oil tanker in the Indian Ocean after tracking the vessel thousands of miles from the Caribbean. Pentagon statements and multiple news accounts say the ship had links to Venezuela and was subject to U.S.…
items.content: What investigators and officials say U.S. military forces intercepted and boarded at least one oil tanker in the Indian Ocean after tracking the vessel thousands of miles from the Caribbean. Pentagon statements and multiple news accounts say the ship had links to Venezuela and was subject to U.S.…

items.title: US boards second tanker in Indian Ocean after tracking it from Caribbean
items.standfirst: The US accuses the Veronica III of violating a "quarantine" on oil shipments from Venezuela.
items.content: The US accuses the Veronica III of violating a "quarantine" on oil shipments from Venezuela.

items.title: US boards second oil tanker in Indian Ocean after it fled Venezuelan raid
items.standfirst: Pentagon tracked sanctioned Veronica III from Caribbean Sea after it left Venezuela on day Maduro was capturedUS military forces boarded another sanctioned tanker in the Indian Ocean after tracking the vessel from the Caribbean Sea in an effort to target illicit oil connected to Venezuela, the Pentagon said on Sunday.Venezuela had faced US sanctions on its oil for several years, relying on a shadow fleet of falsely flagged tankers to smuggle crude into global supply chains. Donald Trump ordered a quarantine of sanctioned tankers in December to pressure the president, Nicolás Maduro, before Maduro was apprehended in January during a US military operation. Continue reading...
items.content: Pentagon tracked sanctioned Veronica III from Caribbean Sea after it left Venezuela on day Maduro was capturedUS military forces boarded another sanctioned tanker in the Indian Ocean after tracking the vessel from the Caribbean Sea in an effort to target illicit oil connected to Venezuela, the Pentagon said on Sunday.Venezuela had faced US sanctions on its oil for several years, relying on a shadow fleet of falsely flagged tankers to smuggle crude into global supply chains. Donald Trump ordered a quarantine of sanctioned tankers in December to pressure the president, Nicolás Maduro, before Maduro was apprehended in January during a US military operation. Continue reading...

ai_summary: US intercepts oil tanker in Indian Ocean
Tanker had fled Caribbean blockade
Vessel linked to Venezuela and sanctions
US military boards tanker to enforce blockade
Action taken to target illicit oil shipments

items.standfirst: The Palestinian Red Crescent say a strike on a tent encampment in northern Gaza killed at least six people.
items.content: The Palestinian Red Crescent say a strike on a tent encampment in northern Gaza killed at least six people.

items.title: At least 12 Palestinians killed and several hurt in Israeli airstrikes on Gaza
items.standfirst: Israel says strikes were in response to Hamas violations of ceasefire as Hamas calls attacks ‘massacre’ of displaced peopleAt least 12 Palestinians were killed and several more injured across the Gaza Strip on Sunday as the Israeli military said it carried out airstrikes in response to ceasefire violations by Hamas.The Gaza civil defence agency said five people were killed and several others hurt when an airstrike targeted a tent sheltering displaced people in the northern city of Jabaliya. Continue reading...

items.title: IDF claims attacks were a response to ceasefire violations
items.standfirst: In the Middle East, new Israeli strikes have hit the Gaza Strip, leaving at least 12 people dead according to the Palestinian Civil Defense, in what is described as a violation of the ceasefire, with Israel and Hamas blaming each other, while at least 601 Palestinians have been killed since the start of the truce last October. France24 journalist Andrew Hilliar shares his insights.
items.content: In the Middle East, new Israeli strikes have hit the Gaza Strip, leaving at least 12 people dead according to the Palestinian Civil Defense, in what is described as a violation of the ceasefire, with Israel and Hamas blaming each other, while at least 601 Palestinians have been killed since the start of the truce last October. France24 journalist Andrew Hilliar shares his insights.

items.title: New Israeli strikes have hit Gaza, leaving at least 12 dead
items.standfirst: In the Middle East, new Israeli strikes have hit the Gaza Strip, leaving at least 12 people dead according to the Palestinian Civil Defense, in what is described as a violation of the ceasefire, with Israel and Hamas blaming each other, while at least 601 Palestinians have been killed since the start of the truce last October. Eliza Herbert has this story.
items.content: In the Middle East, new Israeli strikes have hit the Gaza Strip, leaving at least 12 people dead according to the Palestinian Civil Defense, in what is described as a violation of the ceasefire, with Israel and Hamas blaming each other, while at least 601 Palestinians have been killed since the start of the truce last October. items.title: Airstrikes in Gaza kill 11 people, locals say, as Israel claims Hamas violated ceasefire
items.standfirst: Israeli airstrikes have killed at least 11 people in Gaza, local officials say, including in a blast at a tent encampment housing displaced families.
items.content: Israeli airstrikes have killed at least 11 people in Gaza, local officials say, including in a blast at a tent encampment housing displaced families.

items.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 12, Gaza civil defence agency says
items.standfirst: At least 12 Palestinians were killed by Israel air strikes on the Gaza Strip Sunday, Palestinian officials said, while the Israeli military said the attacks targeted Hamas for violating the October ceasefire. The civil defence agency said one air strike hit a tent of displaced people in northern Gaza while another targeted the southern city of Khan Younis.
items.content: At least 12 Palestinians were killed by Israel air strikes on the Gaza Strip Sunday, Palestinian officials said, while the Israeli military said the attacks targeted Hamas for violating the October ceasefire. The civil defence agency said one air strike hit a tent of displaced people in northern Gaza while another targeted the southern city of Khan Younis.

items.title: Israeli airstrikes kill 11 Palestinians
items.standfirst: Gaza’s civil defence says Israeli airstrikes killed at least 11 people on Sunday, including strikes on a tent camp for displaced families in the north and another in Khan Younis in the south. Israel and Hamas have repeatedly accused each other of violating a US-brokered ceasefire reached in October. France24 correspondent Noga Tarnopolsky reports from Jerusalem.
items.content: Gaza’s civil defence says Israeli airstrikes killed at least 11 people on Sunday, including strikes on a tent camp for displaced families in the north and another in Khan Younis in the south. Israel and Hamas have repeatedly accused each other of violating a US-brokered ceasefire reached in October. France24 correspondent Noga Tarnopolsky reports from Jerusalem.

ai_summary: Israeli airstrikes hit Gaza Strip
At least 12 Palestinians killed in strikes
Attacks targeted tent encampments and homes
Israel claims strikes were response to ceasefire violations
Hamas calls attacks a massacre of displaced people

items.title: Fast-spreading measles outbreak takes hold among under-10s in north London
items.standfirst: UK Health Security Agency urges parents in Enfield to get their children vaccinated as Easter holiday travels approachA big measles outbreak in north-east London is affecting unvaccinated children under the age of 10, the UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA) has confirmed.UKHSA previously reported 34 laboratory-confirmed measles cases among children who attend schools and nurseries in Enfield from 1 January to 9 February, with some requiring hospital treatment. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Anthropic’s Claude helped Pentagon raid Caracas and seize Maduro: US media
clusters.neutral_headline: US Military Used AI In Venezuela Raid

items.title: Anthropic’s Claude helped Pentagon raid Caracas and seize Maduro: US media
items.standfirst: The Wall Street Journal has reported that the Pentagon used Anthropic’s AI model, Claude, as part of its operation to capture Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.
items.content: The Wall Street Journal has reported that the Pentagon used Anthropic’s AI model, Claude, as part of its operation to capture Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.

items.title: US military used Anthropic’s AI model Claude in Venezuela raid, report says
items.standfirst: Wall Street Journal says Claude used in operation via Anthropic’s partnership with Palantir TechnologiesClaude, the AI model developed by Anthropic, was used by the US military during its operation to kidnap Nicolás Maduro from Venezuela, the Wall Street Journal revealed on Saturday, a high-profile example of how the US defence department is using artificial intelligence in its operations.The US raid on Venezuela involved bombing across the capital, Caracas, and the killing of 83 people, according to Venezuela’s defence ministry. Anthropic’s terms of use prohibit the use of Claude for violent ends, for the development of weapons or for conducting surveillance. Continue reading...
items.content: Wall Street Journal says Claude used in operation via Anthropic’s partnership with Palantir TechnologiesClaude, the AI model developed by Anthropic, was used by the US military during its operation to kidnap Nicolás Maduro from Venezuela, the Wall Street Journal revealed on Saturday, a high-profile example of how the US defence department is using artificial intelligence in its operations.The US raid on Venezuela involved bombing across the capital, Caracas, and the killing of 83 people, according to Venezuela’s defence ministry. Anthropic’s terms of use prohibit the use of Claude for violent ends, for the development of weapons or for conducting surveillance. Continue reading...

ai_summary: US military used AI in Venezuela operation
AI model Claude used in raid to capture Maduro
Partnership with Palantir Technologies enabled use
AI used despite terms of use prohibiting violence
Operation resulted in killing of 83 people
